name: Project Hover
description:
A very experimental skating-sim focused on physics, creative skating and customization.

Physics
The player character is fully physical and highly simulated to behave as much as a real person as possible. The goal is to make bails feel as impactful and real as possible. 

Creative Skating
Instead of pre-made tricks, the game sets up a base that then allows you to create and invent tricks similarly to how skating works in real life. 

Customization
Both in-game and externally, player settings can be edited to create a setup that's just right for you. jump height, flip force, head trauma tolerance and many many more values can be modified and easily shared between players.

This early in development I'm still building the core of the game, and some parts are more flushed out than others. So for now, enjoy learning a new way to skate without a traditional goal in mind.

Good to know
A controller is required to play this game.
You can't change to goofy yet. though switch does work.
All visuals are temporary and will change.
There's currently no audio.
There will only be Windows 64bit builds for the time being. Though Windows 32bit, Linux and potentially Apple OSX is aimed to be supported in the future. 

The game will stay available for free during development.
